note: Based on biannual survey data of adults aged 18 years and older. Around 2000 adults are included per survey.
title: Vegans, vegetarians and meat-eaters: self-reported dietary choices in the UK
subtitle:
– Flexitarian: mainly vegetarian, but occasionally eat meat or fish.
– Pescetarian: eat fish but do not eat meat or poultry.
– Vegetarian: do not eat any meat, poultry, game, fish, or shellfish.
– Plant-based / Vegan: do not eat dairy products, eggs, or any other animal product.

relatedQuestions.text: What share of people are vegetarian, vegan, or flexitarians?
